level.heading: Boycott, coercion, and intimidation.
level.text: No person shall enter into an agreement to commit, or by a concerted action commit, an act of boycott, coercion, or intimidation resulting in, or tending to result in, unreasonable restraint of, or monopoly in, the business of insurance.

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For D.C. Law 13-265, see notes following ยง 31-2231.01.
